title: Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan will join Channel Seven's new show Plate of Origin
text:
Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan are set to make a welcome return to TV in 2020.

Just three months after being booted off MasterChef, it's been revealed Matt, 57, and Gary, 52, will appear on Channel Seven's upcoming cooking show, Plate of Origin.

Noticeably absent from the line-up is fellow MasterChef judge George Calombaris, 41, who attracted controversy after underpaying staff at his Melbourne restaurants.

New gig: Gary Mehigan (far left) and Matt Preston (far right) are set to make a welcome return to TV in 2020, joining Manu Feildel (centre) on Channel Seven's upcoming cooking show, Plate of Origin

Joining Matt and Gary on the upcoming cooking show is My Kitchen Rules judge Manu Feildel, 45.

'Food superstars Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan will team up with Manu Feildel for Plate of Origin, a cooking competition with a truly international flavour,' Channel Seven said in a press release on Wednesday.

Seven also announced the new show on their Instagram page, sharing a photo of the three star foodies.

Missing: Noticeably absent from the line-up is fellow MasterChef judge George Calombaris, who attracted controversy after underpaying staff at his Melbourne restaurants. Pictured at the Melbourne Cup in November 2014

'Food superstars Matt Preston (@mattscravat) and @GaryMehigan join @manufeildelofficial for Plate of Origin, where we're not just reaching every corner of Australia… We're going BIGGER!' they captioned it.

'Which cuisine will reign supreme in this worldwide food fight? Let the flames begin.'

It was announced in July that Matt, George and Gary wouldn't wouldn't be returning to MasterChef following a pay dispute.

'Food superstars Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan will team up with Manu Feildel for Plate of Origin,' Channel Seven said in a press release on Wednesday. Pictured, Manu (left) with fellow My Kitchen Rules judge Pete Evans (right)

'We would like to thank Gary, George and Matt for their contribution over the past 11 years,' Network Ten's chief executive officer Paul Anderson said at the time.

'We can't wait to introduce another group - and the next generation of exceptional judges - in season 12 of MasterChef Australia next year.'

Earlier this month, rising culinary stars Andy Allen, Melissa Leong and Jock Zonfrillo were announced as their replacements.
description: Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan are set to make a welcome return to TV in 2020. It's been revealed Matt, 57, and Gary, 52, will appear on Channel Seven's upcoming cooking show, Plate of Origin.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
